steps.title: Task Creation Flow – Step 1: Open task-creation URL
details: Page loads, but UI review flags inconsistent typography, label alignment and padding.

steps.title: Task Creation Flow – Step 2: Form fields visible
details: All expected inputs (Task Name, Description, Deadline, Category) are present.
UI still shows spacing / button-style inconsistencies.

steps.title: Task Creation Flow – Step 3: Submit empty form
details: Automated test times out waiting for required-field error ‘Task Name * is required’.
No helper-text element found → validation errors not rendered.

steps.title: Task Creation Flow – Steps 4-12
details: Remainder of journey blocked because validation did not fire; user cannot continue to add emoji, colour, deadline, category or save task.

steps.title: Task Completion & Progress Tracking – Step 1: Open homepage
details: Home loads, minor alignment issue noted (no tasks present to fully assess).

steps.title: Task Completion & Progress Tracking – Step 2: Identify incomplete task
details: Screenshot captured, but still no forms visible; likely empty-state.

steps.title: Task Completion & Progress Tracking – Step 3: Tick checkbox to mark task complete
details: Automation cannot find checkbox control → element either missing from DOM or not discoverable.
Stops flow; progress-bar and badge checks never executed.

steps.title: Task Sharing & Import – Step 1: Open homepage
details: Page loads with typography and margin inconsistencies noted.

steps.title: Task Sharing & Import – Steps 2-9
details: Flow still running; no failures yet but dependent on earlier ability to create/select a task.

emotional_arc: Initial curiosity turns into mild visual unease (inconsistent spacing/typography). Confidence drops sharply when the form shows no validation feedback and the user is blocked from proceeding. Visiting the homepage feels barren (empty-state) and frustrating when the checkbox to complete a task is invisible. Overall sentiment shifts from hopeful to confused, then to frustrated and mistrustful of the app’s reliability.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users rely on immediate, clear guidance to correct mistakes. Silent failures make the product feel broken and prevent task completion.
next_actions: Render helper-text elements for all required fields; ensure aria-describedby ties inputs to messages for accessibility.
Add unit tests for presence of error text on empty submit.
Use consistent wording and styling (e.g. red text, icon) across all errors.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: If interactive elements are not visible or affordances are weak, users cannot complete core flows (mark done, share).
next_actions: Verify that task items render a checkbox input with clear hit-area on all breakpoints.
Add hover / focus states and label text to reinforce purpose.
Include share icon in the task card with tooltip text; ensure it is present in DOM.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Landing on an empty list without guidance leaves users uncertain what to do next and hides key UI that tests later expect.
next_actions: Design an empty-state illustration plus copy explaining how to add a task.
Surface the ‘Add Task’ CTA prominently even when list is empty.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent visuals reduce perceived quality and can imply broken functionality.
next_actions: Establish design tokens for font sizes, weights, spacing and reuse via CSS/Theme.
Audit margins/padding in form vs. list views; adjust to 8-pt grid.
Standardise button styles (height, border-radius, colour) in shared component library.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users need immediate reassurance that their action (task completed, task shared) succeeded.
next_actions: Ensure progress bar increments visually on task completion; update badge counter in real time.
Add subtle toast notification confirming ‘Task marked as done’ or ‘Link copied’.
Write automated UI tests for these state changes.

first_tackles.description: Fix required-field validation so error messages render instantly on empty submit.
Make task checkbox element visible & accessible on all list items (key blocker to completion flow).
Provide an informative empty-state with a clear ‘Add Task’ button to guide new users.
Apply a quick CSS pass to normalise typography sizes and 8-pt spacing; low effort but high perceived polish.
Add real-time feedback (toast or badge update) when a task state changes to reinforce success.
